description.narrative: Every year, cattle herdsmen migrate from Burkina Faso and Niger to the upper west region of Ghana. The cattle that come into the area cause severe environmental damage, such as contaminating the water, causing erosion and damaging crops. This has caused conflict between local farmers and herders. Fortunately, the Nandakpong Forest Reserve has acted as a buffer between the two groups. This grant will go toward organizing a training for the herders about the importance of the reserve and about appropriate grazing techniques to help preserve the reserve and avoid conflicts with local communities. Funds will be used to enter into negotiation with the Ghana Forestry Commission, who harvests trees from the reserve but does not share any of the profits from the sale of the trees. Therefore, the communities would like to have partial ownership of the reserve and a portion of the proceeds.
